Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 459,410Chapters: 53/?Kudos: 66

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who’ve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 304,603Chapters: 48/?Kudos: 22

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn’t end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they’re reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: dealer
entry.summary:
Author: maydecember

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,550Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 42

Summary: Eventually, Eddie clears his throat. “How aren’t you okay exactly?” he asks, voice steady. “I’m just…” He waves a hand in the air. “I’m just not,” he settles on. “You know, I wanted to be. I really tried. But nothing is helping.” He thinks about what it was like to sit on that floor and know Bobby was going to die. He thinks about what it was like to know he couldn’t do anything about it. “Don’t think I ever really got off that floor.” Eddie hums. “That sounds rough,” he says, voice strained. Buck can tell he’s holding himself back, and of course he is. They haven’t talked like this before. This was the only way for Eddie to get Buck to open up—and why did it have to be? Why couldn’t Buck just talk to him? “Do you feel stuck there?” he asks. He’s looking down at the clipboard he brought with him. “On that floor?” he clarifies a moment later.Eddie acts as Buck’s therapist.

entry.title: You’re the Sun to Me
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,258Chapters: 20/20Kudos: 224

Summary: “Speaking of…you got any idea what this lunch is about? She was pretty vague when she called.” Buck paused, then he shook his head, a small frown pulling between his brows. “Nope. Not a clue.” “But you’re worried,” Eddie guessed. Buck gave a half-shrug, trying for casual, though his hand lingered at Tori’s side like the contact grounded him. “Maddie doesn’t usually do vague. If she says she wants to talk, she wants to talk.” Tori let out a babble just then, saving him from saying more. Buck leaned down, pressing a kiss to the top of her head before scooping her into his arms. “Guess we’ll find out soon enough.” Eddie studied him for a moment. Buck’s answering smile was soft but a little distracted, like his mind was already skipping ahead to lunch. And Eddie couldn’t shake the feeling that Maddie’s words would upend the equilibrium they’d worked so hard to hold. Or, After years of chaos, they’ve built a life full of love and family, but a hidden secret from Buck’s past threatens their fragile peace. When the past collides with the present, even the happiest home feels uncertain.

entry.title: We'll be all the love under the mistletoe
entry.summary:
Author: blackrose_17

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,693Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 140

Summary: Eddie Diaz was happy; he didn’t think that he could be this happy. He has a wonderful husband, his amazing son, and now he has his adorable little girl. He didn’t mind standing in the busy mall full of Christmas shoppers waiting for Buck and Christopher to join them so they could take their little girl to meet Santa for the very first time, even though he didn’t like the idea, but Buck and Christopher wanted to have the memories. He was no longer hiding his sexuality; he was demisexual and proud of it, or, as Chimney teased, he is Bucksexual. So even though he didn’t believe in the universe being out to get him, at this moment, he was. Or Eddie just wants to spend the day with his family and quickly have his daughter meet Santa because it's what Buck wants; he didn't want his day to include running into Tommy and Ana. Meeting Santa was bad enough.

Summary: “I’m in a crisis and I need your help.”  Buck looks over to Eddie, whose eyebrows are furrowed in concentration, completely ignoring the conversation in favor of fighting with the double-sided tape. He clearly isn’t going to get support from his husband, so he turns back to the phone in his hand. “Okay, what do you need?” “Jee is in her ‘go through every closet to find Christmas gifts’ phase and Bee is clinging to us more than ever, so we haven’t been able to move or wrap their gifts. I know Christmas is in a few days and you’re going to be up to your neck is cooking dinner, but-” “You need us to wrap your gifts,” Buck finishes, looking over at Eddie once again and mouthing sorry when he’s met with wide, panicked eyes. Day 2: Gift Wrapping

entry.title: A Very Buddie Christmas
entry.summary:
Author: DianneRose2016

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,983Chapters: 2/24Kudos: 32

Summary: Firefighter Evan “Buck” Buckley has never needed a reason to show up for Eddie Diaz and his son Christopher. especially at Christmas. From tree shopping to gingerbread disasters, the three of them have their holiday traditions down to a science. But when Eddie’s relationship with Ana starts to strain under the weight of those traditions, Buck is forced to confront a truth he’s been trying to ignore: He doesn’t just love being part of their family. He loves them. As the countdown to Christmas ticks closer and tempers flare, Buck and Eddie must decide what, and who, makes a home feel like Christmas. And some wishes don’t fit under a tree… They’re found sitting beside you the whole time. A slow-burn Buddie holiday romance full of warmth, laughter, and the magic of choosing love.

entry.title: The Man Always Left Behind
entry.summary:
Author: eddiebuddiewantssome

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,606Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 5

Summary: After Eddie is shot, he decides to leave the 118, and rewrite his narrative. He re-enlists in the Army, and is sent on deployment. But this time, he's not running from a failing marriage, he's leaving behind the love of his life, Evan "Buck" Buckley. Now, eight months later, he's coming home early, and Buck's about to feel what it's like when he's finally not left behind.
